alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 19 at 1:37PM MDT until April 20 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions This Afternoon; Wind Shift With Associated Cold Front. More Critical Fire Weather Conditions Thursday... .Red Flag Warning has been issued as confidence has increased in multiple hours of critical fire weather conditions with southwest winds gusting up to 45 mph. A wind shift associated with a strong cold front moves through this evening. Blowing dust especially next to open fields is a possibility. The wind shift would create a dangerous situation if a fire were to be ongoing. Confidence has increased in critical fire weather conditions continuing Thursday with northwest winds gusting up 35 mph along with low relative humidity. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 027, 028, 041, 042, AND 253... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday morning through Thursday evening. * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 13 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
